entry.summary: July 25, 2025 3:40 p.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a warrant on Thursday. An RPD report said just after 4:20 p.m. officers arrested the 58-year-old on a failure to appear warrant out of Coos County. The man was detained on $10,000 bail and was released on Friday.

entry.title: The indomitable Sister Jeanita
entry.summary: The Roseburg community has lost a visionary and tireless advocate for the education and well-being of its children. Sister Jeanita Richter passed away peacefully on July 11 in Roseburg in the presence of family and her long-time friend.

entry.title: Douglas County employers add 40 jobs in June
entry.summary: Douglas County’s seasonally adjusted payroll employment increased by 40 jobs in June after an increase of 60 in May and a loss of 160 in April.

entry.title: Wildlife Safari takes in pack of African wild dogs
entry.summary: WINSTON — If there’s one thing Wildlife Safari is known for, it’s big cats. Between their cheetah breeding program and population of cheetahs, lions, tigers and more, the park is a prime spot for viewing nature’s wildest felines.

entry.title: Douglas County Museum receives grant for updated microfilm reader
entry.summary: The Douglas County Museum of Natural and Cultural History has received a $5,000 grant to replace its microfilm reader in the Douglas County Museum’s Lavola Bakken Research Library, according to a July 22 Douglas County Board of Commissioners press release.

entry.title: Gov. Kotek calls for special session to address ODOT funding
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Gov. Tina Kotek announced she is using her constitutional authority to call a special session of the Oregon Legislature to begin Friday, Aug. 29.
